std::vector< cv::DMatch > robotcam::OpenCVMatching::bruteForce ( cv::Mat  descriptors_object,
cv::Mat  descriptors_scene,
int  normType 
)

Bruteforce nearest neighbour matching.

Parameters
descriptors_objectThe descriptors of the query image.
descriptors_sceneThe descriptors of the training scene image.
normTypeThe distance type, e.g. NORM_L1, NORM_L2, NORM_HAMMING.

Definition at line 155 of file openCV_matching.cpp.

cv::Mat robotcam::OpenCVMatching::captureFrame ( bool  color,
bool  undistort,
cv::VideoCapture  capture,
cv::Mat  cameraMatrix,
cv::Mat  distCoeffs 
)

Capture a frame from a connected web camera.

Parameters
colorTrue for RGB. False for grayscale.
undistortTrue for correction for lens distortion. False for no correction.
captureThe object capturing a frame from the web camera.
cameraMatrixThe camera matrix (K-matrix) of the web camera.
distCoeffsThe distortion coefficients of the web camera.
Returns
The current video frame.

Capture a frame in color/grayscale and with or without lens distortion.

cv::VideoCapture  capture 
)

Capture a frame from a connected web camera.

Parameters
colorThe boolean determining RGB or grayscale video frame.
captureThe object capturing the video stream from the camera.
Returns
The current video frame.

Capture either with color or grayscale.

int  min,
int  max 
)

Check if the inner angles of a square or rectangle is within min and max angle.

Parameters
scornerThe training scene corners of the matched object.
minThe minimum angle in degrees.
maxThe maximum angle in degrees.
Returns
True if angle is within min and max. False otherwise.

Get the normalized image coordinates of the matched object scaled with lambda.

Parameters

cv::Point2f  p1,

cv::Point2f &  r 
)
private

Get the intersection point of two lines.

Parameters
o1The origin point of the first line.
p1The end point of the first line.
o2The origin point of the second line.
p2The end point of the second line.
rThe intersection point referenced.
Returns
The boolean whether an intersection was found. True if found. False otherwise.

bool &  binary 
)

Set a descriptor extractor based on a input string.

Parameters
typeDescriptorThe input string as an acronym for wanted algorithm, e.g. SIFT, SURF.
binaryReference to a matching control boolean. True if real-valued descriptor, False if binary.
Returns
The descriptor extractor.

Definition at line 31 of file openCV_matching.cpp.

CurrentMatch robotcam::OpenCVMatching::visualizedMatch ( cv::Mat  searchImage,
cv::Mat  objectImage,
std::vector< cv::KeyPoint >  keypointsObject,
std::vector< cv::KeyPoint >  keypointsScene,
std::vector< cv::DMatch >  good_matches,
bool  showKeypoints,
int  homographyType 
)

Visualize a object matching using homography.

Parameters
searchImageThe training scene image.
objectImageThe query image.
keypointsObjectThe keypoints of the query image.
keypointsSceneThe keypoints of the training scene image.
good_matchesThe good matches between query and training image.
showKeypointsTrue for visualized keypoints. False for no drawn keypoints.
homographyTypeThe homography type, e.g. CV_RANSAC or CV_LMEDS.
Returns
The current match holding an image with visualized matching and the object corners in training scene.
